name: Task Recurrence & Scheduling Rules
description: Flexible scheduling system with recurrence patterns and rules for task automation

prd.problem: Course maintenance tasks occur on various schedules - some daily, some on specific days of the week, some monthly or seasonally. Without a flexible recurrence system, superintendents must manually recreate tasks repeatedly, leading to missed maintenance windows and scheduling inconsistencies.
prd.solution: Implement a comprehensive recurrence engine that supports multiple pattern types (daily, weekly with day selection, bi-weekly, monthly, quarterly, seasonal, annual) with the ability to set preferences, handle exceptions, and adjust for weather or course conditions.
successCriteria: Support for all common recurrence patterns (daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
Ability to specify exact days of week for weekly tasks
Exception handling for holidays and events
Preview of generated schedule before commitment
risks: Complex recurrence rules may be difficult for users to configure
Weather-dependent scheduling may create unpredictable workload
